questionText: A lightweight AP must run a specific version of software in order to operate. Which of the following is true of this software?
explanation: The only time an AP detects that a new code image is available is during its bootup sequence. If there is a new code version available on the WLC, the AP downloads the new file and reboots itself in order to run the new code. Code images are always downloaded directly from the WLC and not from a TFTP server.
comments: 6/23 - query to Au

answerChoices.Text: The new code image is available for download from the WLC, but you must manually instruct each AP to retrieve it.

The new code image is available for download from the WLC; if an AP detects that the code image is different from the one it is already running, it automatically downloads and runs the code right then.
The new code image is stored on a TFTP server, and APs must be configured to download the file from there.
The new code image is available for download from the WLC; as an AP boots up, it compares the new version with its own and downloads the new one if there is a difference.

questionText: Suppose you want an AP to cover a fairly narrow area in a large classroom. The AP's antenna will be mounted on the ceiling, pointed downward toward the classroom seating area. Which of the following antenna types would make a good choice for this scenario?
explanation: A patch antenna is directional, so it would focus RF energy downward toward the classroom seating to cover a relatively small area. A dish antenna is also directional but much more so. If it were used, it would likely focus on an area that would be too small to be practical. An omnidirectional antenna is less focused, and the RF energy would propagate more or less equally around the antenna. That would cover too much area in the classroom. A dipole antenna is a type of omnidirectional antenna, so it would not be well suited for the scenario.

answerChoices.Text: A patch antenna
A dish antenna
An omnidirectional antenna
A dipole antenna

questionText: To determine how effectively an antenna performs in all different directions, which of the following should you reference?
explanation: The antenna radiation patterns will always give the best representation of antenna performance in all directions. This is because the two graphs (E and H) show actual measurements taken in a complete circle around the AP in two different planes. The antenna gain can give you a general idea of performance but does not indicate performance in all directions. The AP's transmit power level and receiver sensitivity values are both independent of antenna performance.

answerChoices.Text: The receiver’s sensitivity graphs
The radiation pattern graphs
The AP's transmit power level
The antenna gain

questionText: Three different antenna types have 5 GHz band gains of 0, 3, and 7 dBi. Which one of the following lists the antenna type names in the correct order, according to the gain values given?
explanation: An isotropic antenna, even though it is only theoretical, has a gain of 0 dBi, which matches the first gain value given. (There are some real antennas in small devices and wireless adapters that also have a gain of 0 dBi, but none of the possible answers list that type.) A dipole has a typical 5 GHz gain of 2 to 5 dBi, matching the second gain value given. Patch antennas have typical 5 GHz gains of 7 to 10 dBi, matching the third gain value given.
comments: 12/2 - ok as-is, 11/29 - query to Au

answerChoices.Text: Omnidirectional, patch, Yagi
Patch, Yagi, dish
Isotropic, dipole, patch
Dipole, patch, isotropic

questionText: Which of the following statements is true about a controller-less wireless deployment?
explanation: Contrary to its name, an embedded wireless controller (EWC) is used. It exists as software running on a regular AP, so no physical controller is involved. While a network with all autonomous APs might be thought of as controller-less, autonomous APs are not used in the Cisco controller-less deployment.

MultipleChoice.Text: ltpgt-openAll APs are autonomous and do not connect to a wireless controller.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-openAn embedded wireless controller is used.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-openNo wireless controllers are owned by the enterprise; they are outsourced instead.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-openThere is a controller running on an AP.ltpgt-close

questionText: To configure granular, customized parameters in a wireless network that uses a controller based on IOS-XE, which one of the following is the final configuration step that is needed?
explanation: After you make configuration settings to site tags, RF tags, and policy tags, you must assign a set of three tags to the relevant APs. You do not need to save anything locally on the APs, and you do not need to reboot them. Assigning the tags takes care of all the customized settings automatically.

answerChoices.Text: Assign tags to all relevant APs
Save the configuration to all relevant APs
Save the running configuration on all relevant APs
Reboot all relevant APs

questionText: Suppose a lightweight AP is joined to a controller and then that controller fails. The AP then tries to join a secondary controller that is running a slightly older code release than the first controller. Which of the following statements is correct?
explanation: A lightweight AP always has to check whether its own code image version is different than that of the WLC it joins. If the versions are different, the AP has to download the WLC's version of code and reboot itself to run the downloaded version. That process takes time and will be disruptive to the end users. Therefore, it is always a good idea to make sure that all WLCs run a consistent version of code.

answerChoices.Text: The AP can quickly join the second controller and continue operating normally.
The AP will not be able to join the secondary controller at all.
The AP needs to take time to download the code image from the second controller and reboot to run that code image.
All code images are backward compatible, so the AP does not need to download anything.

questionText: With a Cisco IOS-XE based wireless controller, you can customize a wireless network in a very granular fashion. To do so, you configure and deploy profiles and which one of the following to APs?
explanation: IOS-XE controllers offer a granular configuration concept that involves configuring and deploying profiles and tags to APs.

answerChoices.Text: Templates
Domains
Tags
Policies

questionText: Identify the correct acronym used in a Cisco controller-less wireless deployment.
explanation: A controller-less deployment uses an embedded wireless controller (EWC) that runs on a regular AP.

answerChoices.Text: EWC
WNC
CLD
CBC

questionText: Which of the following actions takes place first, after a lightweight AP receives power?
explanation: A lightweight AP begins by booting up, and then it tries to discover potential WLCs to join. After that, the AP attempts to join a WLC, download a software image (if needed), download a configuration, and enter the RUN state.

answerChoices.Text: Attempt to join a WLC
Download a software image from a WLC
Enter the RUN state
Download a configuration from a WLC
Discover potential WLCs

questionText: Suppose an AP is connected to a network via a trunk link. The AP is operating in Local mode (not FlexConnect). You notice that there are four VLANs passing over the trunk to the AP, one for each SSID offered on the wireless network. Which one of the following statements must be true about the AP?
explanation: Because there are multiple VLANs extended to the AP, the AP must be in autonomous mode. The AP maps each VLAN to a WLAN or an SSID. If the AP were in lightweight mode, it would need a single VLAN to support its CAPWAP tunnels. Multiple VLANs would be mapped to multiple SSIDs and WLANs by the AP while they were being carried via CAPWAP. There is no such thing as a gratuitous AP.
comments:
4/13 -query to Au

11/28, 8/22, 7/28 - query to Au

answerChoices.Text: A lightweight AP is connected to the trunk link.
An autonomous AP is connected to the trunk link.
A gratuitous AP is connected to the trunk link.
It is not possible to determine the AP mode based on the information given.

questionText: How many IP addresses does a lightweight AP need to support three WLANs with a wireless LAN controller?
explanation: Only one IP address is needed on a lightweight AP. The address is used as a management address, as well as a termination point for the control and data CAPWAP tunnels to the controller.

answerChoices.Text: None
Three: one for each WLAN
Four: one for each WLAN plus one for management
One

questionText: Which of the following lists the correct set of three tags that are assigned to each AP by an IOS-XE based wireless controller?
explanation: Each AP uses three tags to customize the parameters needed to operate. The tags are site, RF, and policy.

answerChoices.Text: AP group, mobility group, RF group
Base, radio, run
Site, band, WLAN
Site, RF, policy

questionText: In case a wireless controller fails, you can prime the APs with information to help them recover in a deterministic fashion. Which of the following correctly describes this information?
explanation: Each AP can be primed with a primary, secondary, and tertiary WLC name or IP address to be used during controller failures. The idea is to point the APs toward another working controller. A list of DNS servers would not help during a controller failure. The names of nearby APs would not help either because a WLC is needed. An AP cannot easily switch to autonomous mode on its own. Even if it could, its connectivity would likely be broken because the switch port where the AP is connected would not be configured in trunking mode with multiple VLANs to extend to multiple WLANs and SSIDs.

answerChoices.Text: The IP addresses of multiple DNS servers
The IP addresses of primary, secondary, and tertiary WLCs
The names of neighboring backup APs
The filename of an autonomous AP code image

questionText: Which one of the following methods does an AP use to detect whether a wireless controller has failed?
explanation: The AP sends periodic keepalive messages to the WLC. By default, the keepalives are sent every 30 seconds. The WLC is expected to reply to each keepalive to demonstrate that it is still alive.

answerChoices.Text: The AP sends a keepalive message to the WLC every 30 seconds.
The AP sends ICMP echo request (ping) packets to the WLC every 15 seconds.
The AP waits for the CAPWAP connection to be reset by the failing WLC.
The AP tries to open a test CAPWAP connection with the WLC every 60 seconds.

questionText: Which of the following statements is correct?
explanation: A lightweight AP and a wireless LAN controller are always connected via a pair of CAPWAP tunnels: one for control traffic and the other for data traffic. A single CAPWAP data tunnel can carry multiple SSIDs and WLANs. Autonomous APs do not use CAPWAP to communicate with a controller. A lightweight AP connects to a Layer 2 switch with a normal wired Ethernet port in access mode. A CAPWAP tunnel to the Layer 2 switch is not needed.

answerChoices.Text: A CAPWAP data tunnel connects a lightweight AP to a wireless LAN controller.
A lightweight AP requires one CAPWAP data tunnel per SSID.
A CAPWAP data tunnel connects an autonomous AP to a wireless LAN controller.
A CAPWAP data tunnel connects a lightweight AP to a Layer 2 switch.

questionText: When multiple wireless controllers are located at remote sites, which one of the following deployment models is being used?
explanation: A distributed deployment has multiple wireless controllers distributed across remote sites or various locations within the enterprise network.

answerChoices.Text: Centralized
Cloud-based
Distributed
Remote

questionText: Antenna gain is a measure of which of the following?
explanation: Antenna gain is a measure of how effective an antenna is at focusing RF energy in a certain direction. For example, antennas with low gain tend to focus less, so the RF energy propagates somewhat equally in all directions. Antennas with high gain focus RF energy in one direction. Antenna gain is not a measure of how effectively an antenna can amplify an RF signal because passive antennas do not amplify at all.

answerChoices.Text: How effectively the antenna can amplify an RF signal
The absolute power level of RF energy exiting the antenna
The frequency range that the antenna is designed to use
How effectively the antenna focuses RF energy in a certain direction

questionText: If a wireless controller is located in a private cloud, the APs connected to it can operate in which of the following modes?
explanation: When the controller is located in a private cloud, it can be connected to the same enterprise network as its APs; therefore, the APs can operate in either Local or FlexConnect mode.

MultipleChoice.Text: ltpgt-openLocalltpgt-close
ltpgt-openFlexConnectltpgt-close
ltpgt-openAutonomousltpgt-close
ltpgt-openCloudltpgt-close

questionText: In a cloud-based wireless deployment, an enterprise’s wireless controller is located in a public cloud. Any APs connected to that controller must operate in which of the following modes?
explanation: In a public cloud-based deployment, the wireless controller can be located quite a distance from its APs. APs must operate in FlexConnect mode so that they maintain a control CAPWAP tunnel to the controller, while data passing through is locally switched at the APs.

answerChoices.Text: Local
FlexConnect
Autonomous
Cloud

questionText: Which of the following measurements is used to locate wireless devices in real time?
explanation: To locate a wireless device, multiple APs must be able to measure the device's received signal strength. That provides an indication of the distance of the device from each AP. Receiver sensitivity and SNR are valid parameters but are not used in location services. Beacon shift is not a valid term.

answerChoices.Text: Receiver sensitivity
SNR
Beacon shift
Received signal strength

questionText: Suppose AP-1 and AP-2 are joined to WLC-1, and AP-3 and AP-4 are joined to WLC-2. A client is associated to AP-1 and then decides to roam to AP-2. This type of roaming is correctly described as which of the following?
explanation: Because the client begins on AP-1 and moves to AP-2, it is able to stay on the same wireless LAN controller. Therefore, the roaming takes place in an intracontroller fashion. If the client roamed to an AP joined to a different controller, then an intercontroller roam would have taken place.

answerChoices.Text: Intra-AP roaming
Intracontroller roaming
Intercontroller roaming
Intradomain roaming

questionText: To support intercontroller roaming with the least impact to wireless clients, WLCs should be configured for which of the following?
explanation: Two controllers must be members of the same mobility group in order to make intercontroller roaming most efficient.

answerChoices.Text: The same RF group
The same mobility group
The same roaming domain
No special configuration

questionText: Suppose a wireless client roams from one AP to another, and the APs are joined to different controllers. Which of the following client-related factors will trigger a Layer 3 roam?
explanation: When the client tries to roam to the new AP and new controller, the two controllers compare the VLAN IDs that are mapped to the original and new wireless LAN. If the VLAN IDs differ, the controllers assume that the client would normally need to obtain a new IP address via DHCP. Instead, the controllers set up Layer 3 roaming for the client so that it can keep using its original IP address.

answerChoices.Text: The SSIDs differ between controllers.
The VLAN ID numbers differ between controllers.
The client's MAC address differs between controllers.
The controller names differ.

questionText: Which of the following are valid methods of making the client authentication process more efficient during the times when clients roam from one AP to another?
explanation: The Cisco Centralized Key Management and 802.11r Fast Transition (FT) techniques can streamline client authentication during roaming events. WPA2 is not applicable because it defines and certifies wireless security features. Dynamic Rate Shifting (DRS) is not applicable because it is the technique a wireless device uses to change the data rate in use according to conditions in the RF environment.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	WPA2ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	CCKMltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	802.11rltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	DRSltpgt-close

questionText: Suppose AP-1 is joined to WLC-1, while AP-2 is joined to WLC-2. A client is associated to AP-1 and then decides to roam to AP-2. Because two different VLAN IDs and subnets are mapped to the WLAN on the two controllers, the client undergoes a Layer 3 roam. In this scenario, WLC-1 takes on which one of the following roles?
explanation: During a Layer 3 roam, the client's original controller takes on the anchor controller role. The client's new controller takes on the foreign controller role. Master controller is not relevant for roaming because it is involved with controlling APs in some scenarios. Handoff controller is not a valid term.

answerChoices.Text: Master controller
Anchor controller
Foreign controller
Handoff controller

questionText: Suppose a wireless client is associated to AP-1, which is joined to WLC-1. The client is using SSID "staff" with IP address 192.168.100.74, which is mapped to VLAN 100. The client moves and then decides to roam to AP-10,which is joined to WLC-2, using SSID "staff" and subnet 192.168.101.0/24, which is mapped to VLAN 101. Which one of the following types of roaming will take place?
explanation: The client device undergoes a Layer 3 roam because it began on VLAN 100 (subnet 192.168.100.0/24) on WLC-1 and ended up on VLAN 101 (subnet 192.168.101.0/24) on WLC-2. Under normal wired circumstances, the client would need to request a new IP address via DHCP when landing on VLAN 101. Instead, the two WLCs can coordinate the client's roam in a way that lets it keep its original IP address. Even though the client can continue using 192.168.100.74 after the roam, some special Layer 3 handling takes place between the controllers.
comments: 2/21 - query to Au

answerChoices.Text: The client will undergo a Layer 2 roam.
The client will undergo a Layer 3 roam.
The client will not be allowed to roam, so it must request a new association on AP-10.
The client will not be allowed to roam at all.

questionText: Suppose a wireless client is associated to AP-1, which is joined to WLC-1. The client is using SSID "staff" with IP address 192.168.100.74, which is mapped to VLAN 100. The client moves and then decides to roam to AP-10,which is joined to WLC-2, using SSID "staff" and subnet 192.168.100.0/24, which is mapped to VLAN 100. Which of the following types of roaming will take place?
explanation: The client device undergoes a Layer 2 roam because it began on VLAN 100 (subnet 192.168.100.0/24) on WLC-1 and ended up on the same VLAN and subnet on WLC-2. Because the client was able to keep its original IP address, no Layer 3 action was needed.

answerChoices.Text: The client will undergo a Layer 2 roam
The client will undergo a Layer 3 roam.
The client will not be allowed to roam, so it must request a new association on AP-10.
The client will not be allowed to roam at all.

questionText: During a Layer 3 roam between two wireless LAN controllers, which one of the following is built between the two controllers to transport the client's data between them?
explanation: A CAPWAP tunnel is built between the anchor and foreign controllers to handle the client's Layer 3 roam. GRE and IPsec are valid tunnel types, but they are not used between WLCs. 802.11Q is a valid type of trunk link and is often used to connect WLCs to the wired network, but it is not used for Layer 3 roaming purposes.

answerChoices.Text: A GRE tunnel
An IPsec tunnel
A CAPWAP tunnel
An 802.11Q trunk

questionText: Suppose AP-1 and AP-2 are joined to WLC-1, while AP-3 and AP-4 are joined to WLC-2. A client is associated to AP-1 and then decides to roam to AP-4. What type of roam is this?
explanation: Because the client begins on AP-1 and moves to AP-4, it must move from one wireless LAN controller to another. Therefore, the roam takes place in an intercontroller fashion. If the client roamed to an AP joined to the same controller, it would be an intracontroller roam.

answerChoices.Text: Intra-AP roam
Intracontroller roam
Intercontroller roam
Intradomain roam

questionText: If a lightweight AP is operating normally and supporting wireless clients with regular wireless service, in what mode is it operating?
explanation: When an AP is operating in local mode, it is providing BSS functions for wireless clients. Monitor mode is used when the AP is acting as a dedicated sensor and only receiving. In bridge mode, the AP becomes a dedicated bridge. Default and normal are not valid mode names.

answerChoices.Text: Default mode
Monitor mode
Local mode
Bridge mode
Normal mode

questionText: Suppose a wireless client is associated to one AP, and then it decides to roam to another AP that is within range. The two APs offer RF coverage that overlaps such that the client always has a viable AP signal to use. Which one of the following methods will the client most likely use to roam to the new AP?
explanation: The client is already associated to the first AP, so moving to a new AP will not require a new association. Instead, the client will most likely send a reassociation request to the new AP so it can simply rehome its association there. The client will likely send a probe request to find any nearby APs as candidates to roam toward, but that is a preliminary step before actually requesting a reassociation.
comments: 2/24/25 - query to Au

answerChoices.Text: Send a probe request to the new AP
Send an association request to the new AP
Send an authorization request to the new AP
Send a reassociation request to the new AP

questionText: RF fingerprinting is the technique for doing which one of the following?
explanation: RF fingerprinting uses an RF calibration template to gauge attenuation throughout a typical area. This information is coupled with the received signal strength measurements made by multiple APs to compute a more accurate location of a wireless device.

answerChoices.Text: Using an RF calibration template to gauge attenuation throughout a typical area
Detecting wireless intrusions
Using an RF calibration template to compute AP transmit power levels
Detecting sources of RF interference

questionText: Suppose you want to configure WPA2-Enterprise on a WLAN. After selecting WPA+WPA2 in the Security > Layer 2 tab, which of the following options should you select to enable EAP?
explanation: 802.1x must be selected in order to use EAP. 802.1x is the port-based access control standard that limits access to the wireless network media until a client successfully authenticates. PSK is not correct because it enables Pre-Shared Key authentication rather than EAP. TKIP is involved with encryption and not authentication. EAP might seem correct because the goal is to enable EAP, but it is not a valid option on a Cisco WLC.

answerChoices.Text: PSK
TKIP
EAP

questionText: If WPA3-Enterprise is used on a WLAN, with which one of the following devices does a wireless client communicate directly with when it authenticates?
explanation: A wireless client communicates only with the WLC, which acts as the authenticator, when authenticating. The WLC is the only device that communicates directly with the authentication server. Therefore, the WLC is the go-between, isolating the clients from the AS.
comments: 3/19 - typo adj

answerChoices.Text: Supplicant
Authenticator
Authentication server
RADIUS server

questionText: Which of the following wireless security methods support PSK authentication?
explanation: Pre-Shared Key (PSK) authentication is supported with the Personal mode of WPA, WPA2, and WPA3. The Enterprise mode of each requires more robust authentication methods, such as EAP.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	WPA2-Personalltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	WPA2-Enterpriseltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	WPA3-Personalltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	WPA3-Enterpriseltpgt-close

questionText: To use WPA2-Personal mode on a WLAN, you must select WPA+WPA2 under the Security > Layer 2 tab. Which of the following is the next logical step in maximizing the security on the WLAN?
explanation: For the most robust use of WPA2-Personal, you should avoid enabling WPA. Therefore, you should make sure the box next to WPA Policy is unchecked and ensure that the box next to WPA2 is checked. You should also avoid enabling TKIP, while enabling AES encryption.

answerChoices.Text: Make sure the box next to AES is unchecked.
Make sure the box next to TKIP is checked.
Make sure the box next to WPA Policy is checked.
Make sure the box next to WPA Policy is unchecked.

questionText: The “enterprise” modes of WPA, WPA2, and WPA3 all involve which one of the following protocols to exchange encryption key material between wireless clients and APs?
explanation: The EAP over LAN (EAPOL) protocol is used in enterprise mode. It consists of a four-way handshake to derive and exchange the encryption key material that is used to secure client-AP connections.

answerChoices.Text: AES256
IPsec
EAPOL

questionText: Suppose you would like to authenticate users with WPA2-Enterprise on a WLAN. Which of the following correctly lists the 802.1x role for each of the three devices that will play a role in the authentication process, in this order: a wireless client, a wireless LAN controller, and a RADIUS server.
explanation: In 802.1x, the client is known as the supplicant, the WLC is known as the authenticator, and the RADIUS server is known as the authentication server (AS).

answerChoices.Text: AS, supplicant, authenticator
Supplicant, authenticator, AS
Authenticator, AS, supplicant
Supplicant, AS, authenticator

questionText: Which of the following methods presents wireless end users with some content to read and an interactive authentication process?
explanation: WebAuth is the only method that can present the end users with web content and interact with them. EAP and LocalEAP provide the means to authenticate but cannot interact with the end user. PSK uses a statically configured pre-shared key for authentication, so it is not a correct answer either.

answerChoices.Text: LocalEAP
WebAuth
PSK
EAP

questionText: Which of the following is considered to be the most robust wireless security suite?
explanation: WPA versions increment over time, and WPA3 is the most recent and most robust version. The term "WPA" without any numeric version number is the same as WPA version 1, which is the least robust version.

answerChoices.Text: WPA2
WPA
WPA3
WPA1

questionText: In the four-way EAPOL handshake between a wireless client and an AP, which of the following key sets are used to encrypt broadcast and multicast traffic?
explanation: The groupwise master key (GMK) and groupwise temporal key (GTK) are used to derive encryption material to secure broadcast and multicast traffic.

answerChoices.Text: PSK, GSK
PMK, PTK
GMK, GTK
BMK, BTK

questionText: To what wireless authentication method do the terms LWA and CWA refer?
explanation: WebAuth can be handled locally on a WLC as local web authentication (LWA). It can also be handled centrally on an external RADIUS server as central web authentication (CWA).

answerChoices.Text: WebAuth
LocalEAP
EAP
Open Authentication

questionText: All versions of WPA use a four-way handshake process to accomplish which of the following tasks?
explanation: The four-way handshake is used by the wireless client and the AP/controller to generate and exchange encryption key material over the air. Once the encryption keys have been generated, the two may pass data securely over the air.

answerChoices.Text: Obtain the wireless client's identity
Generate and exchange encryption key material
Verify the AP's security certificate
Negotiate an acceptable version of WPA to use

questionText: In the wireless LAN configuration on a WLC, the Layer 2 Security parameter has been set to None. Which of the following wireless authentication methods could be used?
explanation: If the Layer 2 Security method has been set to None, this indicates that the WLAN is using Open Authentication. In other words, wireless client devices are authenticated to the APs by simply using the 802.11 standard. EAP, Local EAP, and PSK all require an authentication method other than None or Open Authentication. WebAuth is the only one that can authenticate users through web-based authentication, which can be used in conjunction with Open Authentication, PSK, or EAP.

answerChoices.Text: EAP
PSK
Local EAP
WebAuth

questionText: Which of the following methods can be used to authenticate the identity of wireless users?
explanation: The Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) can be used to authenticate the identity of wireless users. EAP is a framework that can work with many underlying authentication schemes. Dynamic Rate Shifting (DRS) is not involved with authentication because it is used by wireless devices to change data rates as needed. WEP can be used as a deprecated method to authenticate wireless devices but not the identity of wireless users. CAPWAP is the tunneling protocol to connect APs and WLCs, and it is not used for authentication.

answerChoices.Text: DRS
WEP
EAP
CAPWAP

questionText: In the four-way EAPOL handshake between a wireless client and an AP, which of the following key sets are used to encrypt unicast traffic?
explanation: The pairwise master key (PMK) and pairwise temporal key (PTK) are used to derive encryption material to secure unicast traffic.

answerChoices.Text: PMK, PTK
GMK, GTK
UMK, UTK
PSK, GSK

questionText: How many EAPOL messages are exchanged between a wireless client and an AP to derive encryption key material?
explanation: The EAPOL exchange is called a four-way handshake, consisting of four separate EAPOL messages between the client and the AP.

questionText: Which WPA version supports a feature called Simultaneous Authentication of Equals (SAE)?
explanation: WPA3 is the only version that supports SAE. The feature is used to allow either the client, the AP, or both to initiate the authentication process and a robust exchange of encryption key material.

answerChoices.Text: WPA
WPA1
WPA2
WPA3

questionText: Suppose a wireless client has called to report a problem connecting to the wireless network. When you search for the client's MAC address in the controller GUI, you see that there is a green dot next to Association and Authentication, and there is a black dot next to DHCP and Online. Which of the following reasons is most likely the cause of the user's problem?
explanation: Because there is a black dot next to DHCP, the client is waiting to obtain an IP address from the DHCP server. Green dots next to Association and Authentication show that the client has successfully associated and authenticated with the network.

answerChoices.Text: The client cannot authenticate successfully.
The client cannot obtain an IP address.
The AP is rejecting the client's association attempts.
There is no obvious problem, so the client must have internal issues.

questionText: Suppose several wireless users have called to report a problem with slow network performance in one classroom. You record some information about the users and their devices and then open a web browser to the WLC that supports the building in question. Which one of the following should you do next to troubleshoot the problem most efficiently?
explanation: Based on the information given, it seems that the users experiencing the problem are all located in the same room and are perhaps using the same AP. You could begin by searching for and inspecting information about each user, but that would take extra time. That might be an efficient approach if only one user were reporting the problem. Instead, you should probably focus on the APs that are in the classroom. By searching for the APs, you can confirm that they are all powered up and joined to the controller. You can also inspect the channel utilization on each one. High channel utilization translates to poor performance for the associated users. Searching controller logs would likely waste time because the problem appears to be isolated to one room and maybe one AP. Inspecting switch interfaces for errors can be a useful troubleshooting step later on, once you have ruled out obvious, common issues with the RF conditions at the AP and user location.
comments: 1/23 - query to Au

answerChoices.Text: Search for each client device reported to have a problem
Search for APs that are located in the classroom
Search the controller logs to see if the controller is experiencing problems
Connect to the switch where the APs connect and check the interfaces for errors

questionText: A wireless LAN controller can display many parameters about an AP and its operation. Which of the following is not directly useful in diagnosing poor RF conditions around the AP's location?
explanation: The number of associated clients can be useful in determining whether an AP and its channel are overcrowded, but that information does not directly correlate to RF problems. An AP might have many wireless clients associated with it, but if those clients are all idle, the channel will not be greatly utilized. Channel interference, channel noise, and air quality are all important measurements that directly relate to RF conditions and user experience at an AP's location.

answerChoices.Text: Number of associated clients
Channel interference
Channel noise
Air quality

questionText: Suppose you have received reports of a wireless problem in one area of a building. You search the wireless LAN controller supporting the APs in that building and look at the Clean Air information about APs in the affected area. Clean Air shows an active interferer on channel 40, which is a channel used by at least one AP in the area. Based on this information, which of the following actions should you take?
explanation: Because Clean Air has confirmed the presence of an interference source near your APs and users, you should try to locate the interferer and its owner. Hopefully you can work with the owner to either replace the device or move it to a different unused frequency or location. You should also consider moving your affected APs to a different channel, away from the interference. Turning off your APs will keep them away from the interference, but it will also keep your users away from the network. From the information given in the question, users on channel 40 are being affected, so you should try to take some action to mitigate the problem.

questionText: When you search for a wireless client in the controller GUI, a connection score is shown. Which one of the following correctly describes the connection score percentage value?
explanation: The connection score provides a quick way to gauge the client's current performance. If the current data rate is low compared to the maximum it can support, then the client is not able to take full advantage of its capabilities. If the score is high, then the client has an efficient connection.

answerChoices.Text: How quickly the client joined the network compared to all other clients
How long the client has been joined to the network compared to all other clients
The client's current data rate compared to the rates of all other clients
The client's current data rate compared to the maximum rate it supports

questionText: Suppose a wireless client has called to report a problem connecting to the wireless network. When you search for the client's MAC address in the controller GUI, you see that there is a green dot next to Start, and there are black dots next to Association, Authentication, DHCP, and Online. Which one of the following statements is correct about the client and its status?
explanation: Because the only green dot shown is next to Start, the controller has seen some wireless activity from the client device. The black dot next to Association means the client could not successfully associate with an AP that is joined to that controller. Most likely, the client has been configured to join an incorrect SSID, or it is trying to use a security setting that is not compatible with that of the WLAN. The client has failed the Association state, so it has not gotten to the Authentication and DHCP states yet.

answerChoices.Text: The client's wireless adapter is disabled or the client is powered off.
The client cannot obtain an IP address.
The client is getting rejected by a RADIUS server.
The client is probing to find APs but must be using an incorrect SSID or security setting.

questionText: Suppose you are on the phone with a wireless user who has called to report a problem with the wireless network. The user was able to connect and get some work accomplished over the network, but everything seemed to be really slow. Assuming the user is still at the location where the problem occurred, which one of the following offers the best clue about the problem?
explanation: The AP is receiving the client's signal strength at a level of -79 dBm, which is rather low. The signal-to-noise ratio is 11 dB, which is also rather low. Most likely the user is located too far away from the nearest AP to maintain a strong enough signal to support a higher data rate. The client device could also be holding on to the last AP it joined and failed to roam to an AP with a better signal in the current location.

The client's IP address is 10.10.3.27.

questionText: True or False: SSO/NSF and NSR are internal router redundancy features.
explanation: SSO is an internal router redundancy feature that allows a router with redundant RPs to checkpoint (synchronize or mirror) the router configuration, line card operation, and Layer 2 protocol state information from the active RP to the standby RP. NSF is an internal Layer 3 data forwarding plane redundancy feature that checkpoints and frequently updates the FIB from the active to the standby RP. questionText: Which of the following are false statements about NSR?

During an RP switchover, the new RP uses the “checkpoint” state information to maintain the current routing adjacencies and recalculate the routing table without having to alert the neighbor router that a switchover has occurred.

questionText: Under what circumstances would an enterprise choose a collapsed core design over a three-tier model?
explanation: The two-tier model is primarily suited for a network with only a few distribution switches that does not require a dedicated core layer. The decision may also be driven by the building or campus layout. Typically, a single building would fall into the collapsed core model. This may also be determined by the bandwidth required between the various service blocks of the network, WAN aggregation, Internet edge, and data center throughput requirements.

questionText: Which of the following are benefits of a simplified campus design?

	The control plane provides dynamic host mobility for wired and wireless endpoints.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The control plane node implements the LISP map server functionality.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Each router maintains full routing knowledge of all hosts in the network learned through IS-IS.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which statement describes the policy plane implementation in SD-Access?
explanation: The foundation for the policy plane is Cisco TrustSec SGT tags. Users are assigned certain SGT tags, which are then used to implement policy throughout the fabric. This approach abstracts the network address from the policy, which greatly simplifies implementation.

answerChoices.Text: Policy is implemented based on the user’s network address or MAC address throughout the fabric.
A user is assigned a certain network address and VLAN based on the configured policy.
Network policy such as QoS, PBR, and ACL can use SGT tags for classification, which abstracts the user’s network address from the policy, reducing complexity.
The network policy is pushed to each fabric node using the LISP control plane.

questionText: Which of the following allow fabric edge nodes to provide host mobility in the SD-Access fabric?
explanation: The fabric edge node implements the LISP XTR function, which registers EIDs with the control plane node. It is also responsible for sending and receiving traffic from EIDs to and from the overlay. All EIDs receive the same anycast gateway address since all fabric edge nodes are configured with the same SVI and the same IP address per host pool.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	The fabric edge node implements the LISP XTR function.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The Layer 3 anycast gateway allows each edge node to provide a unique default gateway address to users.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The Layer 3 anycast gateway allows each edge node to provide the same default gateway address to users.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The fabric edge node implements the LISP MS/MR function.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which statements are correct with regard to conditional debugging?
explanation: Conditional debugging should be used when a large volume of output is expected. However, caution needs to be taken because not all debug commands support conditional filters. When debugging conditions are set, they are not automatically removed with the undebug all command.
comments: 7/2 - ok as-is, 6/26 - query to Au

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Conditional debugging should always be used.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-open Not all debug commands support conditional filters.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-open debug commands that are expected to produce a large volume of output should be filtered.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-open When issuing the undebug all command, conditional debugging filters are removed automatically.ltpgt-close

questionText: Choose the statement that describes how the IP SLA feature can be used in an enterprise network.
explanation: IP SLA is a very flexible and powerful tool for diagnosing issues related to connectivity to other network nodes or to verify availability of a service, such as HTTP. Several measurements are available, including packet loss, latency, jitter, and mean operation score (MOS). IP SLA can be paired with tracking objects to influence routing or to trigger EEM scripts.

answerChoices.Text: IP SLA reachability can be used to influence routing.
HTTP probes can monitor the availability of a web service by sending artificial HTTP GET requests.
ICMP, TCP, and UDP probes are available to test various aspects of network connectivity.
All of these are correct.

questionText: Which of the following are characteristics of RSPAN?
explanation: RSPAN is a packet capture technique in which the source port and destination port exist on different switches. The SPAN destination is a specially configured VLAN that transports the SPAN data across a Layer 2 link to another switch, where the traffic monitor is connected.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	The source port and destination port are located on different switches.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	SPAN traffic is flooded on all ports in the RSPAN destination VLAN.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	MAC addresses are learned on the RSPAN destination VLAN.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	SPAN traffic is only flooded on RSPAN VLAN destination ports that are trunks.ltpgt-close

questionText: SPAN is a useful tool for performing analysis of network traffic. Which of the following statements correctly describe local SPAN?
explanation: With a local SPAN configuration, both the SPAN source port and the traffic monitor destination port are connected to the same switch. The number of supported SPAN sessions varies by platform, and other restrictions may exist as well. It is possible to span multiple source ports into a single destination port, which could result in drops in the switch or in the destination port.
comments:
2/14 - query to Au

8/23 - ok as-is "Answer D is specifically saying “too many packets”, not “too many SPAN sessions” as the reader interpreted. It is possible to have 5 source gigabit ports into one destination gigabit port and oversubscribe it. It is also possible to span a tengigabit port as a source to a one gigabit port as destination, which would also oversubscribe it. That loss may result in invalid analysis of the span data by the network operator.

 

From the documentation:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst9300/software/release/16-12/configuration_guide/nmgmt/b_1612_nmgmt_9300_cg/configuring_span_and_rspan.html

For SPAN sources, you can monitor traffic for a single port or VLAN or a series or range of ports or VLANs for each session. You cannot mix source ports and source VLANs within a single SPAN session.
The destination port cannot be a source port; a source port cannot be a destination port.
You cannot have two SPAN sessions using the same destination port.
7/28 - query to Au

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	The destination is specified as an IP address and session ID.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The destination interface can’t be reused in another SPAN session.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The destination VLAN is created and then SPAN traffic is sent out all ports in the VLAN.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The destination port may become saturated if too many packets are being replicated. This could affect the analysis of the SPAN data.ltpgt-close

questionText: Choose the answers where starting the investigation with debugging is the most efficient or only method to determine where the problem is occurring.
explanation: debug commands are powerful troubleshooting tools. Applying debug commands to a process or protocol could have potentially negative consequences if the results are not understood. debug commands are useful in troubleshooting interactions between different system processes. Whenever possible, save using debug commands for one of the last steps in troubleshooting, after verifying configurations, counters, packet captures, and so on.
comments:
5/23 - adj per Au

5/3 - query to Au

MultipleChoice.Text: ltpgt-open Use debug ip routing to understand if OSPF is attempting to install a route into the RIB.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-open Use debug ip ospf adj to determine if packets are arriving from a down neighbor, after verifying the configuration.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-open Use debug ip bgp to determine why a particular network prefix is not received from a peer.ltpgt-close
ltpgt-open Use debug ip icmp to determine if a host is reachable from the router after verifying the ARP table.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following are characteristics of the DNA Center Assurance Path Trace?
explanation: The Path Trace tool shows a graphical representation of the path between two endpoints. It allows the operator to see any network impairments or misconfigurations that are preventing connectivity, along with suggestions on how to resolve the issues.
comments:
5/23 - ok as-is, "I believe that the reader has interpreted answer A as correct, but the wording was chosen to be very specific there. The path trace does not show the CLI output, it represents the trace as a graphical representation. In summary, no changes should be needed if I have interpreted their feedback properly."

5/5 - query to Au

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Path Trace provides the output of a traceroute from the CLI of a fabric node to another fabric node.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	A graphical representation of the network path between two endpoints is provided.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Path Trace is currently supported only for wired endpoints.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Path Trace can detect network impairments and offer suggestions to resolve problems.ltpgt-close

questionText: Select the statement that accurately describes SNMP from the choices provided below.
explanation: Three versions of SNMP are available. SNMPv2c relies on community strings to grant RO or RW access. The preferred and most secure version is SNMPv3, which can be configured for both authentication and encryption. SNMP can send traps when certain events occur, such as an interface flap, or when a power supply is removed. Various MIBs define the information available to SNMP from the device.
comments: 6/28 - query to Au

answerChoices.Text: Traps provide regular updates to NMS for values such as interface counters.
SNMPv3 is the preferred version for deployment since it relies on community strings to grant access to system information.
SNMPv2c is the preferred version for deployment since it allows an ACL to filter SNMP messages to the device.
SNMPv3 can be enabled with the authPriv level, which allows both authentication and encryption.

questionText: Which of the following improve the information available in Syslog for troubleshooting purposes?
explanation: By default, the logging buffer of the router is 4096 lines, which is rarely sufficient. The logging buffer should be increased so that any historical events are available. At least one external syslog should be configured to receive and archive the logging data generated by the router. In order to accurately correlate events on multiple devices, syslogs should be enabled with msec granularity, and a network-based time protocol should be configured on every network device for clock synchronization.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Utilizing a network-based time protocol for synchronization of system clocksltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Increasing the default logging buffer to 4096 linesltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Ensuring that all syslog levels are sent to both the console and vty linesltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Configuring the logging timestamps to msec granularityltpgt-close

questionText: The Client 360 view for a user in DNAC provides which of the following?
explanation: Cisco DNA Center with Assurance provides administrators with many tools to assist in troubleshooting. The Client 360 view provides all of the relevant information needed to begin troubleshooting a problem, as well as advanced features like Network Time Travel.

answerChoices.Text: Information about each of the user’s devices, including a health score for each device
The network layer details, such as the device’s VLAN, IP address, and MAC address and where the device is currently connected to the network
A timeline of the health scores for the device, which allows the administrator to look back to a specific point in time when the health score shows an impact
All of these

questionText: Which troubleshooting tool would best determine the path that packets take between two devices in the network?
explanation: While other methods, such as debugging and NetFlow, could also be correct answers here once set up properly, the traceroute option is the simplest.

answerChoices.Text: Conditional debug
ping
traceroute
NetFlow

questionText: Which of the following statements about syslog are correct?
explanation: syslog can provide useful data for troubleshooting. When the logging buffer is modified, its existing contents are flushed. Debugging to syslog is generally safer than debugging to the console line. Ensure that the debugging level for the local buffer is set to 7 and that no logging console is enabled.
comments: 3/2 - query to Au

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	The router can only be configured with a single logging server destination.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	When changing the logging buffer size, existing log entries are flushed.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	When enabling debugging, make sure the logging level for the local log buffer is set to 7.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Console logging should be enabled for debugging.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which statement correctly describes NetFlow?
explanation: NetFlow is enabled on an interface for which packet data will be stored in a cache. The cache is finite in size, and older entries are aged to make room for new ones. Optionally, the cache can be exported to a NetFlow collector for analysis.

answerChoices.Text: NetFlow enables the collection of detailed packet information by sending a copy of the packet to the CPU, where it can be cached and exported for analysis.
NetFlow builds a cache of packets that are processed in hardware. The hardware cache has a finite size limit, which is platform dependent.
NetFlow must cache all packets in a flow.
NetFlow can be configured to drop packets that violate throughput thresholds.

questionText: Which of the following statements are true regarding ERSPAN?
explanation: ERSPAN copies traffic from a local source port to a remote destination IP address. This is done by adding an ERSPAN encapsulation on the packet, which includes an ERSPAN ID to identify the session at the monitor. Since additional encapsulation is added, MTU should be considered between the ERSPAN source and destination as well as the available bandwidth.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	ERSPAN uses a destination VLAN to send SPAN traffic to a remote monitor.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Encapsulation overhead for ERSPAN may result in packet fragmentation, depending on the MTU of the path to the destination.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	ERSPAN allows the source port to be at one location and the destination to be at another location, as long as IP connectivity exists.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	ERSPAN sets a particular TOS value to identify the session.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following statements are true for traditional NetFlow and Flexible NetFlow?
explanation: Traditional NetFlow is considered a legacy feature. It was replaced with the Flexible NetFlow architecture, consisting of flow records, flow monitors, and flow exporters. Flexible NetFlow is a modular approach to configuration and supports v9 and IPFIX export formats.
comments:
5/23 - ok as-is, "Traditional netflow has been deprecated from IOS-XE since release 3.12 (nearly 9 years ago). All configuration guides and documentation uses flexible netflow (flow record, flow monitor, flow exporter). It was documented here:

 https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCuf47392

Traditional netflow (TNF) CLIs are going to be hidden (but still supported) in XE 3.11 and will be deprecated from release XE 3.12 onwards. Customers are strongly encouraged to migrate to using Flexible Netflow (FNF).

5/5 - query to Au

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Traditional NetFlow is considered legacy and has been deprecated from IOS XE.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Flexible NetFlow allows the user to define interesting packet fields in the flow record.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Flexible NetFlow supports v5 export only.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	A flow record is applied directly to the interface with Flexible NetFlow to collect packet statistics.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which statements are correct with regard to Cisco Stealthwatch?
explanation: Stealthwatch receives network telemetry data such as NetFlow exports and performs analysis to detect threats. The Encrypted Traffic Analysis (ETA) feature allows this functionality to be enabled for encrypted traffic without the need to first decrypt that traffic. Stealthwatch is available as an appliance or can be installed in the cloud. UDP direction can be used to feed telemetry data to other appliances, such as LiveAction and Arbor flow collectors.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Stealthwatch is available as a hardware appliance. It is installed as a passive, in-line device to monitor traffic flowing through it.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Stealthwatch can block and report malware attempts.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	NetFlow data is sent to Stealthwatch, and the Stealthwatch UDP director can send data to other network appliances.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Traffic can be analyzed, even if it is encrypted, for malicious patterns.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following statements are true regarding endpoints that do not support a supplicant when the network is enabled for 802.1x?
explanation: MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) provides a fallback method for 802.1x. However, MAC addresses can easily be spoofed, and such spoofing could circumvent endpoint identity-based policies. With WebAuth, another valid fallback method, a web-based authentication portal is used. LWA provides a switch-based web portal that does not support customization with corporate logos or branding, so most people prefer to use the WebAuth option, which does support customization.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	MAB can be used as a fallback authentication method.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	MAB provides a better method of detecting endpoint identity than 802.1x.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	WebAuth can provide an alternate method of authenticating an endpoint; however, it is applicable only to users.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Local Web Authentication (LWA) provides a portal that can be customized with corporate branding.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following statements about Scalable Group Tag (SGT) tags are correct?
explanation: After classification, SGT tags must be propagated in the network. This can be done using the specific EtherType (CMD) 0x8909, which is referred to as inline tagging. There is also a TCP-based method known as SXP that can be used where hardware support does not exist. Practical applications for SGT tags include SGACLs, QoS, and policy-based routing.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Using inline tagging is the only method available for propagation of SGT tags.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The presence of SGT tags in a frame requires the use of a special EtherType.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	SGT tags can be matched in SGACLs to enforce security policies.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The RIB uses SGT tags for forwarding packets to specific next-hop addresses.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following 802.1x device role examples is correct?
explanation: The 802.1x supplicant is typically an endpoint such as Windows, macOS, or AnyConnect that provides identity credentials to the authenticator, such as a WLC.

answerChoices.Text: A Cisco Catalyst 9300 switch is commonly used as an 802.1x authentication server.
The Cisco AnyConnect software can act as an 802.1x supplicant.
The Cisco WLC is an 802.1x supplicant.
None of these are correct.

questionText: Which statement describes the operation of IEEE 802.1AE MACsec?
explanation: MACsec is an Ethernet encryption standard that encrypts frames between two Layer 2 devices. The encryption is not done end-to-end, and frames require decryption for Layer 3 processing. There are two keying mechanisms available: Security Association Protocol (SAP) and MACsec Key Agreement (MKA).

answerChoices.Text: MACsec is an end-to-end encryption model for Ethernet frames.
The IKEv2 protocol is used to provide a keying mechanism.
MACsec requires offloading from the port ASIC to a hardware-based crypto engine for processing.
MACsec can be combined with SGT tags, and the SGT tags are encrypted.

questionText: Which of the following is true of the Cisco SAFE framework?
explanation: Cisco SAFE is an architectural framework that helps in designing secure solutions for all of the various places in the network (PINs), such as branch, Internet edge, and data center. Each of these PINs has their own threat risks, and Cisco SAFE defines secure domains that are used to protect various aspects of the different PINs.

answerChoices.Text: Cisco SAFE defines places in the network (PINs), each of which has its own threat risks.
Cisco SAFE is a set of NGFW rules to protect the Internet edge of a campus network.
Cisco SAFE is a comprehensive set of static point-in-time components that work together to secure an enterprise network.
None of these are true.

questionText: Which is a valid reason to deploy the Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA)?
explanation: The Cisco WSA provides protection before, during, and after a security threat is detected. Integration with AMP allows access to the latest file reputation scores and URL filtering.

answerChoices.Text: WSA can set a filter based on the reputation scores of URLs to prevent phishing or malicious content.
WSA can integrate with Cisco AMP for file reputation scores based on the latest threat information from Cisco Talos.
Data Loss Prevention (DLP) prevents theft of intellectual property by performing deep packet analysis on outbound traffic.
All of these are correct.

questionText: Which statements describe the Cisco Next Generation Firewall (NGFW)?
explanation: The NGFW combines traditional firewall functionality such as filtering and stateful inspection with a NGIPS for intrusion prevention. Integration is available with Cisco Talos for the most up-to-date signatures. Additional capabilities include malware detection, URL filtering, and the ability to automate protection policy updates. NGFW is managed by the Firepower Management Cluster (FMC) for analysis and policy creation.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	The Firepower NGFW can be deployed as a cloud-based virtual appliance.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	The Firepower NGIPS software can be installed with an ASA software image in a single appliance.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Cisco NGFW uses a command line interface to perform policy management and monitoring.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Each NGFW requires it’s own dedicated FMC .ltpgt-close

questionText: When implementing the Cisco SAFE framework, which of the following statements describe the actions an enterprise should take after an attack occurs?
explanation: Cisco SAFE defines steps and solutions to support each phase of an attack (before, during, and after). After an attack has occurred, it is critical to quickly scope, contain, and remediate the threat. This is accomplished using Stealthwatch. It is also important to incorporate any knowledge gained from the attack into the current security solutions to prevent future attacks.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Deploy Cisco ISE for identity servicesltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Utilize Stealthwatch to scope, contain, and remediate an attackltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Incorporate any lessons learned into the existing security solutionsltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Quickly enable policies and look for areas to reduce risk for exploitationltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following statements accurately describes Cisco TrustSec?
explanation: TrustSec is implemented using SGTs. Devices and users authenticate and receive an SGT assignment. The SGT policies are propagated through the network, and they are used to enforce policy in the network.

answerChoices.Text: TrustSec is a solution to authenticate users with AAA or RADIUS.
TrustSec provides a method of enforcing policy through the use of SGTs.
TrustSec uses IPsec with IKEv2 to establish trust boundaries in the network.
TrustSec is a hardware appliance used to enforce web content security by acting as a proxy for user sessions.

questionText: Which of the following are true of Cisco ISE?
explanation: Cisco ISE provides a security policy management platform. It provides secure network access controls for endpoints and users and provides visibility into which users and endpoints are connected to the network. ISE is integrated with Cisco DNAC for the SD-Access solution to provide access control and Cisco TrustSec policy with SGTs, SGACLs, and SXP.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	ISE can be used to implement Cisco TrustSec policy.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	ISE is used to terminate VPN connections from endpoints, providing secure network access.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	ISE is a powerful web content filtering appliance that uses classification from Cisco Talos to assign trust scores to URLs.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	ISE provides a security policy management platform that is used to provide network access control.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following advantages are offered by Cisco Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) compared to traditional antivirus software?
explanation: AMP uses the AMP Cloud database of threat signatures, which allows it to provide superior protection compared to point-in-time antivirus that relies on periodic updates. AMP Cloud contains the file disposition (malware, clean, unknown, and custom), which can be updated based on data from Talos and Threat Grid. AMP is supported on a range of devices, including endpoints, NGFW, ISRs, email, web, and Meraki.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	AMP provides point-in-time protection, which is the superior approach to emerging malware threats.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	AMP provides real-time file disposition based on data from Talos and Threat Grid.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	AMP is supported by endpoints as well as network devices such as NGFW.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	AMP’s local database of malware signatures is superior and gets updated weekly.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which of the following describe the Cisco Umbrella service?
explanation: Cisco Umbrella is a cloud-based DNS solution. It requires no hardware installation or configuration maintenance. Global data centers are configured with the same anycast address, supporting IPv4 and IPv6, which allows Umbrella to provide 100% uptime. Umbrella only requires users to change their DNS server settings to begin using the service. Integration is also available for Cisco routers to redirect DNS requests to Umbrella.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Umbrella provides DNS services using a locally configured and maintained hardware appliance.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Umbrella provides defense against threats by blocking DNS requests to malicious Internet destinations.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Umbrella relies on IP multicast addresses to guarantee 100% uptime.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	Integration is available with Cisco AnyConnect to protect endpoints even when the VPN is not activated.ltpgt-close

questionText: Which statement correctly describes Cisco AnyConnect?
explanation: Cisco AnyConnect is a VPN client that supports IKEv2 or TLS/SSL-based VPN access. It is supported on a wide range of endpoints, including Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and iOS endpoints. AnyConnect can be configured to ensure that endpoints meet requirements for things such as antivirus and host firewall before allowing access to the network. Roaming protection is available with Cisco Umbrella integration.

answerChoices.Text: AnyConnect is used to examine network telemetry data such as NetFlow data and help in the identification and containment of network threats.
AnyConnect is supported only on Windows and macOS products.
AnyConnect is used to provide VPN connectivity using IKEv1.
AnyConnect can be configured to enforce a client’s compliance and restrict network access.

questionText: Which of the following should be modified to reduce overhead and harden the default router configurations?
explanation: Many services and features are enabled by default in Cisco IOS. Disabling them reduces the number of attack vectors and hardens the device. It also saves resources on the router. Many other services are not listed here but can be found on cisco.com, such as the TCP/UDP small services, PAD, and service config.

answerChoices.Text: Enable the CHARGEN service
Disable IP redirects
Disable gratuitous ARP
Enable service configuration to allow automatic updates of router configurations to ensure that the latest ACL definitions are in place

questionText: Which of the following implementations is preferred as a security best practice for console, aux, and vty lines?
explanation: Using a AAA server for authentication is recommended, with a username-based authentication method as a backup. For the local username passwords stored on the device, Type 7 passwords are easily cracked from the value stored in the running configuration. Type 5 passwords are preferred over Type 7 or Type 0. Type 8 and Type 9 are stronger than Type 5 and are considered uncrackable.

answerChoices.Text: Console port using an access class configuration with username-based authentication as backup. Type 7 password encryption.
vty lines with transport input all and password configured under the vty lines.
AAA with username-based authentication as backup. Type 5 password encryption.
AAA with a username-based Type 7 password configured on the vty line.

questionText: Which of the following statements correctly describe TACACS+ and RADIUS?
explanation: AAA supports both RADIUS and TACACS+. RADIUS uses UDP and encrypts only the password field, whereas TACACS+ uses TCP and encrypts the entire payload. RADIUS supports EAP, which makes it the preferred method for implementing secure network access. TACACS+ is the preferred protocol for network device access control because it separates authentication and authorization and allows each CLI command to be authorized.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	RADIUS uses TCP port 49 and encrypts the entire payload. TACACS+ uses UDP for communication.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	TACACS+ is the preferred method for network device access control because it separates authentication and authorization.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	RADIUS is primarily used for secure network access.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open
	TACACS+ supports EAP for 802.1x authentication.ltpgt-close

questionText: Why would ZBFW be used instead of an ACL to protect a branch router connected to the public Internet?
explanation: The main benefit of ZBFW over ACLs is that ZBFW is stateful, and ACLs are not. This allows additional security with Layer 4 through Layer 7 inspection. ZBFW also allows the assignment of interfaces to zones and the use of class maps for traffic classification.

answerChoices.Text: An ACL offers the same protection but has a more complex configuration.
ZBFW provides stateful inspection capability.
An ACL supports passing IPsec without inspection, and ZBFW does not.
All of these are correct.

questionText: Which of the following correctly explains ZBFW configuration?
explanation: By default, an interface not assigned to a security zone is in the default zone. The self zone applies to the router’s own interfaces for management and control plane protocols. Class maps are used to match traffic, and policy maps are used to specify an action for each class (drop, pass, inspect). The inspect action performs stateful inspection. Zone pair order is significant: The first zone should be the source, and the second zone is the destination.

answerChoices.Text: The self zone is used for any interface that is not assigned to another security zone.
The inspect action provides state-based traffic control.
Inspect policy maps include an implicit “permit all,” which drops any traffic that is not matched.
The order of the zone pair is insignificant because traffic between zones is evaluated bidirectionally.

questionText: Which statements are correct with regard to the configuration of CoPP?
explanation: When the CoPP policy map is attached to the control plane interface, the direction should be specified. This is usually applied in the inbound direction to protect the CPU. The class maps defined should match nearly all traffic. Any traffic that is not matched in a class is matched by the class default, which should have minimal traffic in a well-designed policy. Because it does not make sense to congest the punt path with traffic that will be otherwise dropped, most platforms capable of hardware-based forwarding implement CoPP in hardware.

answerChoices.Text: By default, the CoPP policy is applied bidirectionally (both to and from the control plane).
Any traffic not matched in a class falls into the class default.
CoPP policing is implemented in the software forwarding path of the control plane.
All of these are correct.

questionText: Which of the following are valid approaches to implementing a CoPP policy?
explanation: A challenge with implementing CoPP is determining which traffic types should be allowed and how much traffic is normal. This can be answered by using the EPC control plane capture feature. The policers in the CoPP policy can be configured to an estimated value and then assign all the policer actions with transmit to avoid packet drops during this phase. After monitoring, the rates can be adjusted and the exceed or violate action can be set to drop.

MultipleChoice.Text:
ltpgt-open
	Use the Embedded Packet Capture (EPC) tool to capture control plane traffic. This assists in determining what protocols are sending traffic to the device so they can be accounted for in the policy.ltpgt-close

ltpgt-open

questionText: Why do enterprise networks deploy AAA for access control?

questionText: In the diagram, SW1 is routing traffic from VLAN 10 to VLAN 20. There is a PACL applied to switchport Gi1/0/2. explanation: Operators must be aware of the interaction between the various types of ACL applications. The evaluation is different for bridged-only traffic than for routed traffic. questionText: What of the following is true of port access control lists (PACLs) and router ACLs (RACLs)?
explanation: PACLs are configured the same as RACLs with a few key differences. PACLs are applied to Layer 2 ports and are only supported in the ingress direction for filtering. PACLs support filtering for IPv4 or MAC addresses. IPv6 and MPLS encapsulated packets can’t be filtered with PACLs.

questionText: Select the statement that correctly describes ACL functionality.
explanation: ACLs contain sequential lines of ACEs. The ACEs are evaluated sequentially, from lowest to highest, to find a match. If no match is found, an implicit deny any is used as the last ACE entry. Users may apply a single ingress ACL and a single egress ACL to an interface.

answerChoices.Text: ACLs use access control entries (ACEs) to perform permit or deny actions for traffic. ACEs are evaluated from highest sequence to lowest sequence.
An ACL contains an explicit permit any.
Cisco devices allow only one ACL to be applied to the ingress direction and one ACL to be applied to the egress direction on each interface.
ACLs can be either compact or expanded, providing different criteria for ACE matching behaviors.

explanation: IOS defines privilege levels 0 through 15. Level 0 is the lowest. Level 15, the highest, is known as privileged EXEC mode, and it is where all CLI commands are available.
